SEARCH
Package Models

Class Lever

java.lang.Object
Models.Lever
public class Lever extends Object
Lever represents a puzzle element in the game that can be toggled to control the locked state of multiple connections. When a lever is activated or deactivated, all connected doors or passages are updated accordingly, allowing players to open or close routes through the game map.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Lever()
    Creates a new Lever with no targets and an inactive state.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description

    Returns the list of all connections controlled by this lever.
    boolean

    Returns whether this lever is currently in an active state.

  • Constructor Details

    • Lever

      public Lever()
      Creates a new Lever with no targets and an inactive state. Initializes the targets list as an empty ArrayUnorderedList.

  • Method Details

    • addTarget

      public void addTarget(Connection c)
      Adds a connection to this lever's list of targets and sets the connection's locked state based on the lever's current active state. If the lever is active, the connection is unlocked; if inactive, the connection is locked.
      Parameters:
      c - the connection to add as a target

    • toggle

      public void toggle()
      Toggles the active state of this lever and updates all connected targets. When toggled, iterates through all connections and sets their locked state to the inverse of the new active state.

    • isActive

      public boolean isActive()
      Returns whether this lever is currently in an active state.
      Returns:
      true if the lever is active, false otherwise

    • getTargets

      public ArrayUnorderedList<Connection> getTargets()
      Returns the list of all connections controlled by this lever.
      Returns:
      the ArrayUnorderedList containing all target connections
